Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING”
Reviews.Author: catskillaussie
Reviews.Content: A DEFINITE MUST MISS.....Filthy - Dirty - Nothing worked.....The carpet was so dirty, I didn't want to take off my shoes...The shower head was broken and had to be held up...The entire bathroom was filthy. I felt I had landed in a 5th world country - not London. They misrepresented themselves...said the elevator had just broken...Am sure it never did work. We complained and they offered us a basement room that was worse than the first floor room. We had paid in advance for the 5 nights, stayed one night and they didn't want to refund the 4 nights until we said we would call the police. We had travelled around the world and this was our 15th hotel..The 14 hotels before this were terrific and the 9 hotels after this one were also terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Vile”
Reviews.Author: speshalkay
Reviews.Content: I was booked in under recommendation from Olympia, but I will be suggesting they take this off the list as it was utterly horrible. I will give the plus points first. Good location not too far from Gloucester road underground. That's it. Now the not so good points. Dirty rooms, cleaned up to the point the cleaner could reach we assumed (about 5'6"). Curtains not attached and in my associates room the curtain did not cover the window leavinng huge gaps. I complained and they said they would fix it but they didn't. I stood on the step on the 2nd night and watched the RATS plural, cavorting on the front steps! Back and forth, up and down the alley next to the hotel and within 3 inches of me! The breakfast was poor, and there was a towel on the floor next to our table to catch the leak coming from the ceiling! They also cocked up one of our numbers booking and he ended up over the road in another hotel. He definitely got the better deal though! They were rude and unhelpful, I assume from being used to being shouted at. AVOID AVOID AVOID!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: Queenad
Reviews.Content: We selected Derby Hotel in Kensington based on its location. We were not disappointed for its value for money. This was our second trip to London and had stayed in the same area earlier, though in a 4 star hotel. The hotel was just two minutes walk from Earl's Court tube station which has easy access to what a tourist would like to visit. Piccadilly line takes one direct to Heathrow in about 40 minutes. Reception staff was very friendly, check-in was very quick. We were given a room with a comfortable double bed overlooking their private small garden, so it was away from main road traffic noise. The bathroom was clean. Tasty selection of breakfast was served in their restaurant and was included in our rates. Overall, we had a lovely experience with Derby Hotel in London.

Reviews.Title: “Lice, Lice, Lice!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BabyDocs
Reviews.Content: Great location in Kensington. Thought we booked Quality Crown Kensington, but they pulled a switch to this place across the street (owned by the same company). Surly desk staff. Ratty furniture in the room. Mostly clean bathrooms except for the floor around one of the toilets (I cleaned it myself because I could not bear the thought of what the "stains" were). We had a quad room (one double bed and 2 twin beds). Both of the twin beds had LICE, LICE, LICE!!!! How revolting! We saw several mature adult lice and lots of nits. This ONLY happens if: (a) the linens are improperly laundered; or, (b) the bedspreads and/or mattresses are infested and have NEVER BEEN CLEANED. Judging from the poor condition of the bedding and the upholstered chair, I would suspect NEVER CLEANED. Surprisingly, the double bed was free of lice as far as we could determine. Have stay in many, many places and NEVER encountered LICE before. WHEN I SPOKE TO THE WOMAN AT THE FRONT DESK SHE ACTED AS THOUGH SHE DID NOT UNDERSTAND THE WORD "LICE". Truly horrible. We had to launder everything we brought at high temperature AND we had to treat ourselves, lest we transfer these vermin to others. Claimed to have internet, but this was a lie. The only wireless internet was across the street at the Quality Crown, if you stayed in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Derby, Cromwell Rd., London: Give this London Hotel a MISS!”
Reviews.Author: Laura-Sweeney
Reviews.Content: Date of Visit: April 2009 Reviewer: Dublin Family, 2 children Review: The Photos of the bedrooms on their Website are not of the bedrooms we were in. I checked the other bedrooms, as I thought we may have pulled the short straw. We were in 3 bedrooms over the 3 nights! Broken showers, lack of light bulbs, traffic noise, general grubbiness e.g.cigarette holes in the 'dining room' chairs. Work men in our bedroom fixing the curtains while we were in the bedroom! Reception's explanation was 'it is a 3 star' what did you expect? We paid for 2 out of the 3 nights and got the immpression that people frequently haggled about the price. We have been visiting London for years and when I was a student I stayed in cleaner, better, accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: Bobsen
Reviews.Content: If I could give no stars, I would. I have just returned from London where I spent four days at this 'hotel'. I choose this place based on previous users comments, boy, was that wrong. My son and I were there during the three hottest days in June and it was sure misery. The tiny, cramped room was street side with the never ending traffic noises blaring right outside the window 24 hours a day. The windows themselves appeared to be last washed sometime last century and only the bathroom one could be opened fully to allow some air to circulate. The refrigerator was non-working and when I inquired at the front desk, I was told all the refrigerators were non functioning! The free WIFI in the lobby happens to be in the lobby of the hotel ACROSS the street! The free in room safe costs 3 pounds an DAY! And housekeeping is a joke. I half expected to get some sort of skin infection from the toilet and shower facilities. The water pressure was minimal and water temperature was unstable. The kicker was when I went down to complain I was told I got this 'budget' room because I used a third party to book it (rejsefeber.dk) and had I booked direct I would have gotten a much better, non street side room! The food was tasteless and expensive to the point that when offered a free 'upgrade' to the 'full' English breakfast I declined. It seemed as if the food was reheated until it was finally eaten. Perhaps, this was a fine place back in the day but not now. Avoid at all costs, you will be happy you did.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: Jacktor31623
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Derby Hotel for a total of 3 nights in February 2009. The hotel is situated very close to the Gloucester Road tube station which offers service on the District, Circle, and Piccadilly lines, enabling you to get to the majority of the top sites in the city. For the location, it was reasonably priced. However, we had some difficulty finding the hotel, as the directions provided on the website are somewhat misleading - the website says the hotel is located across from the Sainsbury's supermarket when it is in fact a good bit further down the road. Our room was decent with a clean bathroom, small television, and complimentary shampoos and lotions; however, it appeared that one of the bottles of lotion had previously been opened which was somewhat displeasing. The maid service was somewhat slacking, as our bed was never really made but rather the sheets were thrown up to the pillows. Our room was also located right across the hall from the elevator which was extremely noisy throughout the night. The breakfast that came with the room was good, but be sure to check if your room comes with a continental breakfast or a full English breakfast - the food on the table isn't very clearly defined as to which foods are included in each breakfast. The majority of the staff in the dining area were very pleasant, with the exception of the red-haired woman who "greets" you upon entering. She was quite rude and made us feel unwelcome. The staff at the front desk was helpful as they held our bags for the afternoon after we checked out; however, they all seemed extremely disinterested in their jobs. They did provide us with forks and plates one night when we wished to eat in our room. Additionally, our room reservation came with "30% off bar drinks," but there was no working bar to be found in the hotel. Overall, our stay at The Derby Hotel was satisfactory - our breakfast filled us up in the morning and we had a bed to sleep in at night. Its great location helps to make up for some of its lacking qualities.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: cathandpete
Reviews.Content: Nothing more to say other than it's one of the worst hotels I've ever stayed with. Not very clean, terrible decor, and very run down. Staff are not very friendly, and weren't willing to sort out errors. The only good thing is the location!

Reviews.Title: “fair rooms, good service, good location”
Reviews.Author: jo5847654684645
Reviews.Content: rooms are oldish, but clean and no "bad suprises"; 24h reception, friendly service, excelent neighbourhood, good metro service; meets expectations, nothing fancy, but does meet expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - shame about the hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: SAM.46
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Derby during February school hols with husband and 2 teenagers. We were given a basement room ( told by reception staff it was on ground floor ! ) looking UP to the front street - noisy but bearable. Sink in bathroom had a large crack in it, but could still be used and yes the curtains fell off when closed ! ( reported and fixed ) we returned to the room on the 4th day to find a huge hole in the sink - we were moved to the room opposite which was much better as it was overlooking the garden. Breakfast ok but with respect, the staff could learn to speak better english, couldnt understand anything we asked.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad stay....”
Reviews.Author: MaggieNice
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in this hotel to be close to most sightseeing areas and our stay was pretty dreadful. The reception staff was unfriendly and rude, same goes for the breakfast-room staff (who could barely speak english). The room was dirty, the carpeting was ripped in several places. The hotel claims to have been fully renovated in 2007, but you couldn't see that from the dirty furnitures in the downstairs area and the room. The room was extremely noisy, no double-windows, you could hear the constant traffic all day and all night. The worst stay in a hotel ever, the hotel should be considered a 2* instead.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful”
Reviews.Author: Emma_and_Dan_Derby
Reviews.Content: My stay here was awful. We arrived just after 7pm, having booked this hotel as a way to break up Eurostar travel and then onward train journey home, the reception was unmanned, there was no bell to draw attention. After a few minutes a young man came from what I now know to be the bar / breakfast room, and gave us the key to our room. When we got there the first thing I did was draw the curtains, to block out traffic noise as we were on front of hotel and obscure the view in from the hospital over the road. At first I laughed thinking i'd overpulled the curtains, then it became obvious they were too small for the window, about a 6 inch gap. Having since read the reviews of other people on here, I know this is not uncommon. I went to reception and asked about this, if this could be resolved as the noise from traffic was loud and no way would I sleep. The man stated the room we were in was a "very nice room" and the ONLY other free room was a compact room. He gave me the key so I could have a look and yes it only just fit in a queen sized bed, but it was on back of hotel, yes the curtains didn't fit the window but not so overlooked. So compact it was. The next drama was when we wanted to go out to get a meal, we left the room only to find the door wouldn't lock properly, we hadn't been offered a key to the safe, so going out seemed like an improbability. We got it shut and locked in the end, but it seemed flimsy and nipped to sainsburys and back, didn't dare venture further. I tried to contact Easyjet who I'd booked with but couldn't get through, I desperately wanted to be reallocated elsewhere. The shower had a leak on the pipe and the toilet didn't flush first attempt, but we had a bed. And with the chain on the door we about managed a few hours kip. At breakfast I noticed the list that the woman who asked our room number showed more free rooms that just the grotty one we'd been put in, so I almost spoke to the suited man at reception who appeared to be a manager, but figured the best we'd be offered was an upgrade to the full english, or at worst case a complimentary stay, and I certainly wouldn't go back there. Not for me.

Reviews.Title: “Is anybody in charge here or even interested ?”
Reviews.Author: UK_Manchester
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in October 2008. First, the plus points. The location is within seven or eight minutes walk of either Gloucester Road or Earl's Court tube stations. You can be at any Central London location within 20 minutes of leaving the hotel. There is a good selection of restaurants between the hotel and Gloucester Road Station. We had certain grievances with this hotel. When we first entered the room we noticed one of the curtains was coming off its rail. It was impossible to close the curtain in the evening and during the night it fell down and woke us up. We brought this to the attention of the reception the following morning and were told it would be sorted out. When we returned early in the evening we saw that it had been taken away but not replaced. We reminded reception that we were without the curtain and again were told "No problem blah blah blah". Needless to say nothing was done for the rest of our stay. Who knows whether or not the curtain has yet been replaced. This window was on ground level looking onto the garden and thus was a major issue. We did not sleep well because of uncomfortable mattresses as we could feel the springs. The corridor outside our room appeared to be the routine home for black binbags possibly full of laundry although we did not examine the contents. On arrival we had to move two of them to get past with the suitcases. The price included a full English breakfast which consisted of sausages, bacon, scrambled eggs, mushrooms, baked beans, tomatoes and hash brown triangles. This might sound delicious but it was not cooked to order but sat in heated containers as part of the buffet table. After the first morning we could not stomach that again and played safe with the continental. All in all, this hotel needs somebody to take charge and sort out some niggling problems. Guests should not have to prise up the bathroom sink plug with fingernails in the absence of a working plunger.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dav008
Reviews.Content: Visited London with my husband and son (age 13)and stayed at the Derby Hotel. We booked a family room consisting of a double bed and single. On arriving the hotel did not have a record of the room request even though I showed confirmation from the website. We ended up with 3 single beds in the room. The room was OK although a little dated and the carpet looked grubby. The curtains did not close properly so light came through at night. On the first night roadworks took place directly outside the hotel and because the hotel does not have secondary or double glazing the noise was horrendous and none of us got any sleep. But even worse the mattress on the beds was the worst we have ever experienced. Very lumpy and it felt as if the springs were coming through the material. We reported this to the receptionist the next day who did report it to housekeeping. The chambermaid put a cover over the mattress making them more comfortable for that night's sleep. So we were pleased with that - they acted promptly. Breakfast was the worst we have ever experienced. The continental breakfast consisted of cereal, some meat, toast or croissants. No yoghurt or eggs. An extra charge was made for a cooked breakfast. Not impressed at all. We will not stay there again. The accommodation was just too basic for the cost per room and breakfast was very inadequate. Also bad mattresses and awful curtains.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Elegant Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: r0se_0_shar0n
Reviews.Content: Stepping down at Kensington tube station, I asked a taxi driver to name a few of the best hotels nearby and he straightaway recommended Derby Hotel amongst others saying it is a budget hotel in Kensington with pristine elegance spread throughout. First not trusting the cab driver, I checked out with the rooms and prices and found that the driver was not wrong. The rooms were quiet spacious and most importantly neat and clean. I was offered good service and hospitality by kind and humble staff members of the hotel throughout my stay. Very good breakfast was served in the Hotelâ€™s elegant restaurant itself with exciting discounts on bar drinks and special vouchers of W8 pizza lounge at Quality crown Hotel Kensington, just lying opposite. My major problem of having many cups of tea in a day was solved with the complimentary tea and coffee tray served in the hotel room which was serviced twice daily and was up to date with all the modern amenities and facilities one requires including 42â€� Plasma TV. This Derby hotel is just a few minutes walk from Earlâ€™s court tube station, Kensington High Street and many museums and Olympia exhibition centre which provided extreme convenience to me by all means. I will always be thankful to the cab driver and will surely return back to this beautiful hotel which gave me topmost luxury and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Booked the Derby, but they sent us to the Quality Crown across the street”
Reviews.Author: franceotbp
Reviews.Content: I booked a 5 nights stay in a family room for 4 persons, 2 adults and 2 children (12 and 9 years old), at the Derby Hotel Kensington for my family's trip to London. I booked directly with the hotel and informed them that we would arrive in the evening for check-in. I was quite surprised when we arrived to the hotel to check-in, because they immediately informed us that we were not staying at the Derby Hotel, but instead they had reserved us not 1, but 2 rooms across the street at the Quality Crowne Kensington Hotel, a 4-star property where they apparently have a relationship. I wasn't sure if this change of plans and the surprise of being switched to another hotel was a good surprise or not, as I have had quite a few previous experiences with hotels at 3 and 4 star levels in London and in London the star rating doesn't really mean as much as it should, unless you book 5-star then of course the hotel is sure to deliver what it should. Continuing, we crossed the street and proceeded to check in at the Quality Crowne. I was disappointed that our rooms were not connecting rooms, as with 2 young children in a large city, I would have preferred to have had direct access to my kids from my room. Instead we had to exit our rooms and travel between them via the corridor to see one another. The rooms were clean, except for one day, there was a dirty-stained comforter cover placed on my daughter's bed and a stained pillow case on my son's pillow, but Prashant at the front desk was very courteous and had both changed promptly while we were out for dinner. One morning we awakened to NO water in the hotel. This delayed our day, as we had to wait for 1 hour for the boilers to be fixed and another hour to have hot shower water, and during most of the break down time, we had no water at all, meaning unable to flush toilets or even brush our teeth. While waiting for the repairs we went ahead to the breakfast room and had a lengthy breakfast, and crossed paths with other hotel guests looking as rugged as us, like they just rolled out of bed, what could we do, so we just tried to make the most of it and eventually at 10 am were able to have showers and start our day. The hotel staff was very courteous during the boiler breakdown and I almost felt sorry for the young girl working the front desk, as she had been insulted by several guests because of the problem. Other than that we had a nice stay, windows are sound proof so one doesn't hear any of the outside traffic noise, as the hotel is located on very busy cromwell street. The Derby hotel across the street though must be incredibly noisy though, as there is apparently no A/C, because we saw guest windows open all of the time, windows that give right onto the busy street. All in all, I am disappointed that I can't give more feedback about the Derby Hotel itself since they switched us to another hotel, but I would recommend that if you book a room at their hotel to ask them to confirm if you'll be staying at the Derby or at the Quality Crowne across the street. As for restaurants, if you continue down cromwell street, about a 10 minute walk, towards Earl's Court, there is a large selection of small boutique style restaurants offering all types of cuisine from Indian to Thai, traditional, French, pub style and at reasonable prices, our personal favorite for the kids was the Gourmet Burger Kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bitian
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to staying at the Derby Hotel based on reviews but was disappointed after staying there for four nights. I'll start off with the positives. Clean hotel with decent sized rooms for London in an excellent location in Kensington, with plenty of restaurants and close to Earls Court Tube station. Now with the negatives. The staff seemed indifferent and bored when approached. The lift did not work for our entire stay. The curtains in the room were to small for the window so they did not block out all the light. The room was not soundproofed which made it difficult to sleep because of the traffic noise. (room was located on busy Cromwell road). If that wasn't enough, the bed was the most uncomfortable I have ever slept on, you would expect more comfort in a hostel bed. Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else in Kensington as it is a beautiful area.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: candyp63
Reviews.Content: Very cute, clean hotel. Unfortunately the airconditioning has no individual controls and is set at a very warm temperature. Also, there are no screens on the windows so opening a window offers little relief. Quite a bit of street noise also. A good budget hotel overall, and very close to the tube.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mambababe
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Derby for 5 nights in March 2008. Positives - good location, close to tube station, plenty of restaurants nearby, good price for a London hotel, it was clean, and a simple Continental breakfast was included in the price. Negatives - I like peace and quiet and pitch black to sleep. Unfortunately our room was at the front of the hotel overlooking the main road and hospital - the windows were not double glazed so it was LOUD. Take your ear plugs and you'll be fine. Also, the curtains didn't meet, so might be an idea to pack an eye mask too!

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem in a Great Location !!”
Reviews.Author: Miel_1
Reviews.Content: I came to stay at the Derby Hotel because the places I usually stay were fully booked. It was obviously a very busy time but the staff were really very good - all of them, in my case, always calm, smiling and very helpful with the few questions I had. As others have mentioned, I found the hotel generally and my room very clean and, for central London 3 star, the double room was really exceptionally large and the bed very comfortable. The bathroom and the bedroom had everything I needed. It is obviously quite a small hotel and I can see why they refer to it as a "boutique-style" - it is nicely decorated in a sort of "quirky" way, the corridors are wide like an American newly built hotel and the restaurant on the ground floor, with its outlook over a lovely small garden (which guests can use, by the way) is really quite unusual in this standard of hotel. There is a sort of family hotel feel to the place, so that I felt quiet and relaxed when I was there even though the hotel was obviously full. The location of the Derby Hotel is extremely good - about 2 minutes walk from Earls Court tube station *Piccadilly and District Lines) and with the 174 (?) bus route really close by, so it was very easy to get to where my meetings were (edge of the City, close to Holborn) each morning and back again in the evening. Having compared the price with where I usually stay and what I know of London prices, I think I got a very reasonable rate, even though I was booking at the last moment at a busy time. So, don't be put off by their slightly 'gloomy' photos of the outside of the hotel. Once you get inside, it's lovely. Full marks !

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: Tripping_Woman
Reviews.Content: I booked a 6 night stay (room 402) in this hotel based on the previous "star" reviews. The good news -- excellent location; large bathroom, lots of hot water, good sized bedroom, mini fridge.The worst problem was the noise -- this hotel is situated on a major thoroughfare across from the Cromwell Hospital (yes, ambulances). If you insist on staying here -- don't book a front room, Advice for hotel - replace the holey sheets, the hairdryer held together with duct tape; the tattered and singed lampshades; and get rid of the black growth on the grouting of the tub. These are all fairly simple things to remedy and would make a world of difference as far as overall impression goes. Staff were fairly good -- some definitely friendlier than others. It was clean. Definitely not a boutique hotel. Would not pay more than what I paid. ($114/night) and only if I had no alternative for the price range.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, good price”
Reviews.Author: kemosabe41
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Easter weekend and had a double room for my wife and I and a family room for my in-laws (2 adults, 2 teenagers). Great location near two tube stops 5 minute walk to each. Once on the tube its no more than 8 or 9 minutes to Westminister which is nice. Our rooms were nice and basic. Bathroom was clean and mini fridge was a nice bonus. The TV reception was poor, but we weren't there that long to watch much TV. Breakfast was fine, breads, yogurt canned peaches and some deli meats and cheese. We got a rate of 110 pounds for the double and 140 for the family I think, which is a good deal for London given its location and cleanliness. Desk staff helpful and friendly. They let us check in a few hours early which was good. I would stay here again, just remember its a small basic hotel, so don't expect luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Worth money spent”
Reviews.Author: MichaelBr00ks
Reviews.Content: Recently me and my friend spent two nights at Derby Hotel Kensington. The experience was not very bad considering it being a small hotel. The staff at the reception desk seemed to be very enthusiastic and were always busy helping guests. The location of the hotel was good, as was at walking distance from Earls Court and one more tube station, which has excellent connections to all the places in London, including Heathrow airport. Most of the important historic attractions of London are in this region and within easy reach of this hotel. We got a very good deal on the room rates, and they had included breakfast in the rates. The breakfast was well prepared and the variety of food catered to all tastes. We ate a large breakfast both days and didn't need to buy lunch, thus saved some pounds, which we used for shopping on High Street Kensington. The room was mid sized, with king bed, and running hot and hot water in the bathroom. The room was cleaned and linen changed every day, without asking, which was not expected from such a small hotel. The only complaint we had was non availability of air conditioning, which helps in maintaining the room temperature in both summer and winter. The heating arrangement was fine, so no complaint on that side. We will definitely use this hotel on our next visit to London and will also recommend to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mariuskavli
Reviews.Content: Arrived around noon to check in, and although the check in-time was 2 pm, we were able to get a room thanks to the very nice man behind the counter. The service we got at the hotel was a bit mixed, as the Indian(?) man made us feel very welcome, but not even a smile from the others. Location is perfect as the hotel is situated within a short walk, both to Earl's Court and Gloucester Road station. (300m and 500m). We got the room but was a little bit disappointed as the bathroom was very cold. Asked the other receptionist if they could turn the heat up, as the tiling felt like cold pavement in the morning, but nothing was done. The 230V plug in the bathroom for shavers was also disfunctional. Unfortunately, the water in the shower had to be running for at least 10 minutes before we could even feel any hot water. To get wifi connection in my room, I had to connect to the Premier Inn hotel nearby, as all the other networks didn't work, and is obviously not suitable for business travellers. The hotel had a computer in the lobby with Internet access available at Â£1 per 10 minutes. The hotel didn't charge us when we left our luggage in the back room when needed either. I can easily recommend this hotel to others, as the standard is much better compared to other hotels in the same price range.

HotelInfo.Name: Derby Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 155-157 Cromwell Road, London SW5 0TQ, England
